column4: ok let me ask again. on my windows boot - the internet conection is automatic through my network card to the building's internet infrastructure. i do not need to configure anythin
in ubuntu it is not working. the eth0 is picked up
it is even giving me the DNS to use
ifconfig eth0  whats your ip?
anything yet?
i am dual booting so i can not check now
do you have ext3?
you can use this to see your ubuntu files so you dont have to reeboot quite as much  http://www.fs-driver.org/
are you connecting directly to a modem?
you'd have to be in linux
you use gnome or kde?
have to used the network option under System | Administration ?
- it is enabled. gateway is set to eth0
but you are using the gui config?
ok.. make sure it's enabled and set to DHCP. write down your DNS from windows and put it in there too
go to windows control panel, right click your eth connection, select properties
yipe...could it be your netowrk admin?>
i have an idea
is your ubuntu cd the live cd? with a desktop and all?
should i try that? what diff would that make?
still around??
